The electron correlation parameter, $\Gamma_e$, is defined as the ratio of the average unscreened electron-electron potential energy to the electron kinetic energy. It is expressed as:
\[ \Gamma_e = \frac{e^2}{4\pi \epsilon_0 a_{ws}} \frac{1}{k_B T_e} \]
where $a_{ws}$ is the Wigner-Seitz radius, related to the electron density by $\rho_e = 1/( \frac{4}{3} \pi a_{ws}^3)$.
